info.name: Fastly
info.description: The Fastly API is a RESTful API that supports all features available through the Fastly web interface. Use the libraries below to guide the development of your sites and applications.

item.name: Authentication
item.description: To use the Fastly API you will need to create a valid API token. This token will be used to authenticate your API requests.

item.name: API Tokens
item.description:
API tokens are unique authentication identifiers that you can create for the users and applications authorized to interact with your service. You can scope the authorization of tokens to a single service, and you can restrict access to purge all by limiting tokens to purging by URL and surrogate keys. Because users can create multiple API tokens, you can rotate tokens without taking services offline, and you can revoke individual tokens without having to update other API integrations.

[API Tokens Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/auth#tokens)

request.description:
**Description:**

List all tokens belonging to the authenticated user.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/auth#tokens_d59ff8612bae27a2317278abb048db0c)

**Description:**

List all tokens belonging to a specific customer.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/auth#tokens_bc1370f9b3432d4423d35aa25a889c5a)

**Description:**

Get a single token based on the access_token used in the request.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/auth#tokens_bb00e7ed542cbcd7f32b5c908b8ce244)

**Description:**

Create a limited API token. The token can be limited by a service, an expiration, and a scope access level.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update **Fastly-OTP** property in headers (only if two-factor authentication is enabled)
- **name** [string] - Name of the token.
- **scope** [string] - Space-delimited list of authorization scope (optional, defaults to "global"). Scope can be either global, purge_select, or purge_all.
- **expires_at** [string] - Time-stamp (UTC) of when the token will expire (optional). Expiration date format (e.g., 2016-07-28T19:24:50+00:00).
- **services** [array] - List of alphanumeric strings identifying services (optional). If no services are specified, the token will have access to all services on the account.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/auth#tokens_db4655a45a0107448eb0676577446e40)

**Description:**

Create a none limited API token.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update **Fastly-OTP** property in headers (only if two-factor authentication is enabled)
- **name** [string] - Name of the token.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/auth#tokens_db4655a45a0107448eb0676577446e40)

**Description:**

Revoke a token that is used to authenticate the request.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/auth#tokens_e0b9ecbbbfc21f5ee6531441bf743082)

**Description:**

Revoke a specific token by its id.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update URL with **token_id**

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/auth#tokens_4a958ba69402500937f0d8570f7ce86f)

**Description:**

Revoke Tokens in bulk format. Users may only revoke their own tokens. Superusers may revoke tokens of others.

**Request Configuration:**

- **id** [string] - The alphanumeric string identifying a token.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/auth#tokens_3ec6f9aec76f49e345c0d41deef29369)

item.name: Account
item.description: In addition to the Fastly web interface, we offer a few API functions specific to managing your account, its users, and billing options, and we list them here for ease of reference.

item.name: Billing
item.description:
Get information on current and past bills.

[Billing Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/account#billing)

request.description:
**Description:**

Get the invoice for a given year and month.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update URL with **billing_year**
- Update URL with **billing_month**

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/account#billing_66fbdce6042f18eddff809a17e329a3b)

item.name: Billing Address
item.description:
A billing address is used to calculate your bill correctly.

[Billing Address Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/account#billing_address)

request.description:
**Description:**

Get a customer's billing address.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/account#billing_address_01449df2d3702b2f6b333e0c1a33c6d5)

**Description:**

Delete a customer's billing address.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/account#billing_address_522cd343bac2efbd334cdf90ebf5d619)

item.name: Customer
item.description:
A Customer is the base object that owns your Users and Services.

[Customer Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/account#customer)

request.description:
**Description:**

List all users from a specified customer id.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/account#customer_12f4a69627ba3bbb1c8668aae03a60ad)

**Description:**

Get the logged in customer.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/account#customer_01dffc0769482c6e3501ccb07da8491e)

**Description:**

Get a specific customer.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/account#customer_05dd6e95148aa70ada2a65ba47111d62)

**Description:**

Update a customer.

**Request Configuration:**

- **name** [string] - The name of the customer, generally the company name.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/account#customer_e4ec815bc6f19880ced6f6b3542e55a6)

**Description:**

Delete a customer.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/account#customer_ce5cf95d92310b0d5a76210630deb1df)

item.name: Event Logs
item.description:
Event logs used to audit actions performed by customers. Events can be filtered by user_id, service_id, customer_id and event_type.

[Event Logs Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/account#events)

request.description:
**Description:**

List all events for a particular customer.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/account#events_78ed310c6d59be709d53ddafbe786699)

**Description:**

Limit the returned events to a specific customer.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update query string **page[number]** parameter in URL
- Update query string **page[size]** parameter in URL

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/account#events_78ed310c6d59be709d53ddafbe786699)

**Description:**

Limit the returned events to a specific service.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update query string **page[number]** parameter in URL
- Update query string **page[size]** parameter in URL

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/account#events_78ed310c6d59be709d53ddafbe786699)

**Description:**

Limit the returned events to a specific user.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update query string **page[number]** parameter in URL
- Update query string **page[size]** parameter in URL

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/account#events_78ed310c6d59be709d53ddafbe786699)

**Description:**

Get a specific event.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update URL with **event_id**

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/account#events_af65d8072ba18f4045361d6a904a4a64)

item.name: Invitation
item.description:
Invitations allow users to create accounts that operate under a main customer account. For bulk operations and access control specification, see the [Invitations API endpoint](https://docs.fastly.com/api/account#invitations) instead.

[Invitation Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/account#invitation)

request.description:
**Description:**

Get all open invitations created by the customer.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/account#invitation_16709c86a9f50c6917b7d2ebe654d8fb)

**Description:**

Create a new invitation and email it to the recipient.

**Request Configuration:**

- **email** [string] - The email address of the invitee.
- **role** [string] - The user-assigned permissions role. Can be user, billing, engineer, or superuser.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/account#invitation_12f719e0157f4d73a919f7c4a044aa24)

**Description:**

Cancel an open invitation.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update URL with **invitation_id**

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/account#invitation_2b23b38a0e15a7012e976d013c7de7e1)

item.name: User
item.description:
A user of the Fastly API and web interface. A user is always associated with a customer.

[User Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/account#user)

request.description:
**Description:**

Get the logged in user.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/account#user_91db9d9178f3f4c7597899942bd3f941)

**Description:**

Get a specific user.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update URL with **user_id**

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/account#user_15a6c72980b9434ebb8253c7e882c26c)

**Description:**

Create a user.

**Request Configuration:**

- **login** [string] - The email address, which is the login name, of this user.
- **name** [string] - The real life name of the user.
- **require_new_password** [boolean] - Indicates if a new password is required at next login.
- **role** [string] - The role of this user. Role can be billing, engineer, user, or superuser.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/account#user_00b606002596bac1c652614de98bd260)

**Description:**

Update the user's password to a new one.

**Request Configuration:**

- **old_password** [string] - The old password.
- **new_password** [string] - The new password.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/account#user_711c16f29c73b9532eabbf332cc4ee1d)

**Description:**

Requests a password reset for the specified user.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update URL with **user_email**

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/account#user_cee4dbb44c07d9ed078424cbbd353e1a)

**Description:**

Update a user. Unless you are a **superuser** on your account, this can only change your own user.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update URL with **user_id**
- **login** [string] - The email address, which is the login name, of this user.
- **name** [string] - The real life name of the user.
- **require_new_password** [boolean] - Indicates if a new password is required at next login.
- **role** [string] - The role of this user. Role can be billing, engineer, user, or superuser.


[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/account#user_8f189d86d4d92e792687cb2cfbfb7841)

**Description:**

Delete a user.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update URL with **user_id**

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/account#user_7a284c40e1eafa3f8cd912a0dc1e6971)

item.name: Configuration
item.description: This section of the API documentation covers the pragmatic configuration of your services, in complement to the web interface.

item.name: ACL
item.description:
An ACL is a named access control list for matching against a client's IP address during VCL processing. A new ACL is empty and is attached to a working version of a service (not locked or active). The version associated with the ACL must be activated to be used. To remove an ACL from use, the ACL must be deleted from a working version (not locked or active), and that version without the ACL must be activated.

[ACL Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#acl)

request.description:
**Description:**

List ACLs.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#acl_5dfdb4b644ee42fcb71f3c3f139e3b0d)

**Description:**

Create a new ACL for a particular service and version.

**Request Configuration:**

- **name** [string] - Name for the ACL. Must start with alphanumeric and contain only alphanumeric, underscore, and whitespace.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#acl_c2e66498f77f346e715deedb616f2dcd)

**Description:**

Retrieve a single ACL by name for the version and service.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#acl_ea46be7e9fb009d231bdc47690cc1762)

**Description:**

Update ACL for a particular service and version.

**Request Configuration:**

- **name** [string] - Name for the ACL. Must start with alphanumeric and contain only alphanumeric, underscore, and whitespace.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#acl_a07615df96bab601c4889062fa5869a0)

**Description:**

Delete an ACL for a particular service and version.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#acl_62526fdbe826b794a6655fbb66f987a9)

item.name: ACL Entry
item.description:
An ACL entry holds an IP address with optional subnet to make up an entry in an ACL. ACL entries are versionless and can be modified without activating a new version. ACL entries can also be negated.

[ACL Entry Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#acl_entry)

request.description:
**Description:**

List of ACL entries given service and ACL ID.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#acl_entry_25ff5c4d6ab5f53842e216a4ea355978)

**Description:**

Create ACL entry given service, ACL ID and properties.

**Request Configuration:**

- **ip** [string] - An IP address.
- **subnet** [string] - An optional subnet for the IP address.
- **negated** [boolean] - A boolean that will negate the match if true.
- **comment** [string] - A personal freeform descriptive note.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#acl_entry_777431aac7f63fee19c553c1fc9fae06)

**Description:**

Retrieve a single ACL entry given service, ACL ID and entry ID.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update URL with **entry_id**

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#acl_entry_a637fad7f4c0014d2168d0a3b6f6a769)

**Description:**

Update ACL entry given service, ACL ID, entry ID and properties.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update URL with **entry_id**
- **ip** [string] - An IP address.
- **subnet** [string] - An optional subnet for the IP address.
- **negated** [boolean] - A boolean that will negate the match if true.
- **comment** [string] - A personal freeform descriptive note.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#acl_entry_2d6a045ce1db8c8d5229747d9c494e4b)

**Description:**

Update ACL entries in batch given service, ACL ID, entry ID and properties.

**Request Configuration:**

- **op** [string] - Value can be either create, update, delete.
- **ip** [string] - An IP address.
- **subnet** [string] - An optional subnet for the IP address.
- **negated** [boolean] - A boolean that will negate the match if true.
- **comment** [string] - A personal freeform descriptive note.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#acl_entry_c352ca5aee49b7898535cce488e3ba82)

**Description:**

Delete ACL entry given service, ACL ID, and entry ID.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update URL with **entry_id**

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#acl_entry_8ab8e771a201b24bee9ee64c7a45f464)

item.name: Backend
item.description:
A backend is an address (IP or domain) from which Fastly pulls content. There can be multiple backends for a service.

[Backend Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#backend)

request.description:
**Description:**

List all backends for a particular service and version.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#backend_fb0e875c9a7669f071cbf89ca32c7f69)

body.raw:
{
	"auto_loadbalance": false,
	"between_bytes_timeout": 10000,
	"comment": "your_comment",
	"connect_timeout": 1000,
	"error_threshold": 0,
	"first_byte_timeout": 15000,
	"healthcheck": null,
	"hostname": null,
	"ipv4": "127.0.0.1",
	"ipv6": null,
	"max_conn": 200,
	"max_tls_version": null,
	"min_tls_version": null,
	"name": "your_backend",
	"port": 80,
	"request_condition": null,
	"shield": null,
	"ssl_ca_cert": null,
	"ssl_cert_hostname": null,
	"ssl_check_cert": true,
	"ssl_ciphers": null,
	"ssl_client_cert": null,
	"ssl_client_key": null,
	"ssl_sni_hostname": null,
	"use_ssl": false,
	"weight": 100
}

request.description:
**Description:**

Create a backend for a particular service and version.

**Request Configuration:**

- **auto_loadbalance** [boolean] - Whether or not this backend should be automatically load balanced.
- **between_bytes_timeout** [integer] - How long to wait between bytes in milliseconds.
- **comment** [string] - A comment.
- **connect_timeout** [integer] - How long to wait for a timeout in milliseconds.
- **error_threshold** [integer] - Number of errors to allow before the backend is marked as down.
- **first_byte_timeout** [integer] - How long to wait for the first bytes in milliseconds.
- **healthcheck** [string] - The name of the healthcheck to use with this backend. Can be empty.
- **hostname** [string] - The hostname of the backend.
- **ipv4** [string] - IPv4 address of the host.
- **ipv6** [string] - IPv6 address of the host.
- **max_conn** [integer] - Maximum number of connections.
- **max_tls_version** [integer] - Maximum allowed TLS version on SSL connections to this backend.
- **min_tls_version** [integer] - Minimum allowed TLS version on SSL connections to this backend.
- **name** [string] - Name of the token.
- **port** [integer] - The port number.
- **request_condition** [string] - Condition, which if met, will select this backend during a request.
- **shield** [string] - The shield POP designated to reduce inbound load on this origin by serving the cached data to the rest of the network.
- **ssl_ca_cert** [string] - CA certificate attached to origin.
- **ssl_cert_hostname** [string] - Overrides ssl_hostname, but only for cert verification. Does not affect SNI at all.
- **ssl_check_cert** [boolean] - Be strict on checking SSL certs. Setting to null will use the system default value (true).
- **ssl_ciphers** [string] - List of OpenSSL ciphers (see https://www.openssl.org/docs/manmaster/apps/ciphers.html for details).
- **ssl_client_cert** [string] - Client certificate attached to origin.
- **ssl_client_key** [string] - Client key attached to origin.
- **ssl_sni_hostname** [string] - Overrides ssl_hostname, but only for SNI in the handshake. Does not affect cert validation at all.
- **use_ssl** [boolean] - Name of the token.
- **weight** [integer] - Weight used to load balance this backend against others.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#backend_85c170418ee71191dbb3b5046aeb6c2c)

**Description:**

Get the backend for a particular service and version.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#backend_5c0b2bcd6144eadbb6570ddf3c454b8b)

body.raw:
{
	"auto_loadbalance": true,
	"between_bytes_timeout": 10000,
	"comment": "your_updated_comment",
	"connect_timeout": 1000,
	"error_threshold": 0,
	"first_byte_timeout": 15000,
	"healthcheck": null,
	"hostname": null,
	"ipv4": "127.0.0.10",
	"ipv6": null,
	"max_conn": 200,
	"max_tls_version": null,
	"min_tls_version": null,
	"name": "your_backend",
	"port": 80,
	"request_condition": null,
	"shield": null,
	"ssl_ca_cert": null,
	"ssl_cert_hostname": null,
	"ssl_check_cert": true,
	"ssl_ciphers": null,
	"ssl_client_cert": null,
	"ssl_client_key": null,
	"ssl_sni_hostname": null,
	"use_ssl": false,
	"weight": 50
}

request.description:
**Description:**

Update the backend for a particular service and version.

**Request Configuration:**

- **auto_loadbalance** [boolean] - Whether or not this backend should be automatically load balanced.
- **between_bytes_timeout** [integer] - How long to wait between bytes in milliseconds.
- **comment** [string] - A comment.
- **connect_timeout** [integer] - How long to wait for a timeout in milliseconds.
- **error_threshold** [integer] - Number of errors to allow before the backend is marked as down.
- **first_byte_timeout** [integer] - How long to wait for the first bytes in milliseconds.
- **healthcheck** [string] - The name of the healthcheck to use with this backend. Can be empty.
- **hostname** [string] - The hostname of the backend.
- **ipv4** [string] - IPv4 address of the host.
- **ipv6** [string] - IPv6 address of the host.
- **max_conn** [integer] - Maximum number of connections.
- **max_tls_version** [integer] - Maximum allowed TLS version on SSL connections to this backend.
- **min_tls_version** [integer] - Minimum allowed TLS version on SSL connections to this backend.
- **name** [string] - Name of the token.
- **port** [integer] - The port number.
- **request_condition** [string] - Condition, which if met, will select this backend during a request.
- **shield** [string] - The shield POP designated to reduce inbound load on this origin by serving the cached data to the rest of the network.
- **ssl_ca_cert** [string] - CA certificate attached to origin.
- **ssl_cert_hostname** [string] - Overrides ssl_hostname, but only for cert verification. Does not affect SNI at all.
- **ssl_check_cert** [boolean] - Be strict on checking SSL certs. Setting to null will use the system default value (true).
- **ssl_ciphers** [string] - List of OpenSSL ciphers (see https://www.openssl.org/docs/manmaster/apps/ciphers.html for details).
- **ssl_client_cert** [string] - Client certificate attached to origin.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#backend_fb3b3529417c70f57458644f7aec652e)

**Description:**

Delete the backend for a particular service and version.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#backend_a00ce4b7a448b63d26016837907e7bfa)

item.name: Cache Settings
item.description:
Controls how caching is performed on Fastly. When used in conjunction with Conditions the Cache Settings provide you with fine grain control over how long content persists in the cache.

[Cache Settings Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#cache_settings)

request.description:
**Description:**

Get a list of all cache settings for a particular service and version.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#cache_settings_0d6fb6b78afaa453ec69a5dbd4038322)

**Description:**

Create a cache settings object.

**Request Configuration:**

- **action** [string] - Allows for termination of execution and either cache, pass, or restart.
- **cache_condition** [string] - Name of the condition used to test whether this settings object should be used.
- **name** [string] - Name for the cache settings object.
- **stale_ttl** [integer] - Sets the max "Time To Live" for stale (unreachable) objects.
- **ttl** [integer] - Sets the "Time To Live".

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#cache_settings_015578a5dee074dd7fa45c4962b2c867)

**Description:**

Get a specific cache settings object.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update URL with **cache_setting_name**

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#cache_settings_9e1fcc14944551fadf3da3f87ff338a9)

**Description:**

Update a specific cache settings object.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update URL with **cache_setting_name**
- **action** [string] - Allows for termination of execution and either cache, pass, or restart.
- **cache_condition** [string] - Name of the condition used to test whether this settings object should be used.
- **name** [string] - Name for the cache settings object.
- **stale_ttl** [integer] - Sets the max "Time To Live" for stale (unreachable) objects.
- **ttl** [integer] - Sets the "Time To Live".

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#cache_settings_3416e629201894d017dc69fd07500eda)

**Description:**

Delete a specific cache settings object.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update URL with **cache_setting_name**

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#cache_settings_9adabaabeb01d84b2c02c2dbc5b4bbda)

item.name: Condition
item.description:
Conditions are used to control when and how other objects are used in a service configuration. They contain a statement that evaluates to either true or false and is used to determine whether the condition is met. 

Depending on the type of the condition, the statement field can make reference to the Varnish variables **req**, **resp**, and/or **beresp**.

[Condition Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#condition)

request.description:
**Description:**

Get all conditions for a particular service and version.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#condition_b61196c572f473c89863a81cc5912861)

**Description:**

Creates a new condition.

**Request Configuration:**

- **comment** [string] - A comment.
- **name** [string] - Name of the condition.
- **priority** [integer] - Priority assigned to condition. Order executes from 1 to 10, with 1 being first and 10 being last.
- **statement** [string] - The statement used to determine if the condition is met.
- **type** [string] - Type of the condition, either "REQUEST" (req), "RESPONSE" (req, resp), or "CACHE" (req, beresp).

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#condition_551199dbec2271195319b675d8659226)

**Description:**

Get the specified condition.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update URL with **condition_name**

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#condition_149a2f48485ceb335f70504e5269b77e)

**Description:**

Updates the specified condition.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update URL with **condition_name**
- **comment** [string] - A comment.
- **name** [string] - Name of the condition.
- **priority** [integer] - Priority assigned to condition. Order executes from 1 to 10, with 1 being first and 10 being last.
- **statement** [string] - The statement used to determine if the condition is met.
- **type** [string] - Type of the condition, either "REQUEST" (req), "RESPONSE" (req, resp), or "CACHE" (req, beresp).


[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#condition_01a2c4e4b44943b541e001013b665deb)

**Description:**

Deletes the specified condition.

**Request Configuration:**

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#condition_2b902b7649c46b4541f00a920d06c94d)

item.name: Dictionary
item.description:
A Dictionary is a table that stores key value pairs accessible to VCL functions during VCL processing. A new dictionary is empty and attached to a working version of a service (not locked/active). In order for the dictionary to appear in generated VCL, the version associated with the dictionary must be activated. To remove a dictionary, the dictionary must be deleted on a working version (not locked/active), and that version without the dictionary then must be activated.

[Dictionary Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#dictionary)

request.description:
**Description:**

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#dictionary_6d2cc293b994eb8c16d93e92e91f3915)

item.name: Dictionary Item
item.description:
A DictionaryItem holds a key and value that make up an entry in a Dictionary. DictionaryItems are versionless so they can be modified without activating a new version.

[Dictionary Item Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#dictionary_item)

[Diff Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#diff)

item.name: Director
item.description:
A Director is responsible for balancing requests among a group of Backends. In addition to simply balancing, Directors can be configured to attempt retrying failed requests. Additionally, Directors have a quorum setting which can be used to determine when the Director as a whole is considered "up", in order to prevent "server whack-a-mole" following an outage as servers come back up.

[Director Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#director)

request.description:
**Description:**

List the directors for a particular service and version.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#director_a0bd94075a81102f3ca4ff1f498a48ef)

**Description:**

Create a director for a particular service and version.

**Request Configuration:**

- **backends** [array] - List of backend associated with this director.
- **capacity** [integer] - Load balancing weight for the backends.
- **comment** [string] - A comment.
- **name** [string] - Name for the Director.
- **quorum** [integer] - The percentage of capacity that needs to be up for a director to be considered up. Integer, 0 to 100 (default: 75).
- **retries** [integer] - How many backends to search if it fails (default: 5).
- **shield** [string] - Selected POP to serve as a "shield" for origin servers.
- **type** [integer] - What type of load balance group to use. Integer, 1 to 4. Values: 1=random, 2=round-robin, 3=hash, 4=client (default: 1).


[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#director_c533bd0e9feb118959406c540b085ce1)

**Description:**

Get the director for a particular service and version.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#director_98da5c0617843d547c33a47d214eeb26)

**Description:**

Update the director for a particular service and version.

**Request Configuration:**

- **backends** [array] - List of backend associated with this director.
- **capacity** [integer] - Load balancing weight for the backends.
- **comment** [string] - A comment.
- **name** [string] - Name for the Director.
- **quorum** [integer] - The percentage of capacity that needs to be up for a director to be considered up. Integer, 0 to 100 (default: 75).
- **retries** [integer] - How many backends to search if it fails (default: 5).
- **shield** [string] - Selected POP to serve as a "shield" for origin servers.
- **type** [integer] - What type of load balance group to use. Integer, 1 to 4. Values: 1=random, 2=round-robin, 3=hash, 4=client (default: 1).


[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#director_96a02b07eb58711a94d585ea228e62c3)

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#director_a0279c85ea20c315855e393ab63e2524)

item.name: Director Backend
item.description:
Maps and relates backends as belonging to directors. Backends can belong to any number of directors but directors can only hold one reference to a specific backend.

[Director Backend Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#director_backend)

request.description:
**Description:**

Establishes a relationship between a Backend and a Director. The Backend is then considered a member of the Director and can be used to balance traffic onto.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#director_backend_6926a1fc561d50ab8773e8c6c8382d38)

**Description:**

Returns the relationship between a Backend and a Director. If the Backend has been associated with the Director, it returns a simple record indicating this. Otherwise, returns a 404.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#director_backend_80bd8da752936527f466566783c10733)

**Description:**

Deletes the relationship between a Backend and a Director. The Backend is no longer considered a member of the Director and thus will not have traffic balanced onto it from this Director.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#director_backend_92985fb9fc147d24a0c8a3720dafd5e1)

item.name: Domain
item.description:
A domain represents the domain name through which visitors will retrieve content. There can be multiple domains for a service.

[Domain Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#domain)

request.description:
**Description:**

Checks the status of all domains DNS records for a Service Version. Returns an array of 3 items. The first is the details for the domain, the second is the current CNAME of the domain, and the third is a boolean indicating whether or not it has been properly setup to use Fastly.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#domain_e33a599694c3316f00b6b8d53a2db7d9)

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#domain_30a3f14c9a0ce5730757d39983ab7dc6)

item.name: Gzip
item.description:
Gzip configuration allows you to choose resources to automatically compress.

[Gzip Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#gzip)

request.description:

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#gzip_48db6845448669e5b59928ed821efe25)

**Request Configuration:**

- **cache_condition** [string] - The CACHE condition controlling when this gzip configuration applies. This field is optional.
- **content_types** [string] - Space-separated list of content types to compress. If you omit this field a default list will be used.
- **extensions** [string] - Space-separated list of file extensions to compress. If you omit this field a default list will be used.
- **name** [string] - The name of the gzip configuration.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#gzip_79873f2776db6de57dafef8fe8bf3632)

**Description:**

Get the gzip configuration for a particular service, version, and name.

**Request Configuration:**

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#gzip_bf53ccf18e903955cdf96acf4e10d397)

**Description:**

Update a named gzip configuration on a particular service and version.

**Request Configuration:**

- **content_types** [string] - Space-separated list of content types to compress. If you omit this field a default list will be used.
- **extensions** [string] - Space-separated list of file extensions to compress. If you omit this field a default list will be used.
- **name** [string] - The name of the gzip configuration.

item.name: Header
item.description:
Header objects are used to add, modify, or delete headers from requests and responses. The header content can be simple strings or be derived from variables inside Varnish. Regular expressions can be used to customize the headers even further.

[Header Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#header)

request.description:
**Description:**

Retrieves all Header objects for a particular Version of a Service.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#header_dd9da0592b2f1ff8ef0a4c1943f8abff)

**Description:**

Creates a new Header object.

**Request Configuration:**

- **action** [string] - Accepts a string value, one of:
	- set - Sets (or resets) a header
	- append - Appends to an existing header
	- delete - Delete a header
	- regex - Perform a single regex replacement on a header
	- regex_repeat - Perform a global regex replacement on a header
- **cache_condition** [string] - Optional name of a CacheCondition to apply.
- **dst** [string] - Header to set.
- **ignore_if_set** [integer] - Don't add the header if it is added already (Only applies to 'set' action).
- **name** [string] - A handle to refer to this Header object.
- **priority** [integer] - Lower priorities execute first (Default: 100).
- **regex** [string] - Regular expression to use (Only applies to 'regex' and 'regex_repeat' actions).
- **request_condition** [string] - Optional name of a RequestCondition to apply.
- **response_condition** [string] - Optional name of a ResponseCondition to apply.
- **src** [string] - Variable to be used as a source for the header content (Does not apply to 'delete' action).
- **substitution** [string] - Value to substitute in place of regular expression (Only applies to 'regex' and 'regex_repeat').
- **type** [string] - Accepts a string value, one of:
	- request - Performs on the request before lookup occurs
	- fetch - Performs on the request to the origin server
	- cache - Performs on the response before it's stored in the cache
	- response - Performs on the response before delivering to the client

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#header_151df4ce647a8e222e730b260287cb39)

**Description:**

Retrieves a Header object by name.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update URL with **header_name**

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#header_86469e5eba4e5d6b1463e81f82a847e0)

**Description:**

Modifies an existing Header object by name.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update URL with **header_name**
- **action** [string] - Accepts a string value, one of:
	- set - Sets (or resets) a header
	- append - Appends to an existing header
	- delete - Delete a header
	- regex - Perform a single regex replacement on a header
	- regex_repeat - Perform a global regex replacement on a header
- **cache_condition** [string] - Optional name of a CacheCondition to apply.
- **dst** [string] - Header to set.
- **ignore_if_set** [integer] - Don't add the header if it is added already (Only applies to 'set' action).
- **name** [string] - A handle to refer to this Header object.
- **priority** [integer] - Lower priorities execute first (Default: 100).
- **regex** [string] - Regular expression to use (Only applies to 'regex' and 'regex_repeat' actions).
- **request_condition** [string] - Optional name of a RequestCondition to apply.
- **response_condition** [string] - Optional name of a ResponseCondition to apply.
- **src** [string] - Variable to be used as a source for the header content (Does not apply to 'delete' action).
- **substitution** [string] - Value to substitute in place of regular expression (Only applies to 'regex' and 'regex_repeat').
- **type** [string] - Accepts a string value, one of:
	- request - Performs on the request before lookup occurs
	- fetch - Performs on the request to the origin server
	- cache - Performs on the response before it's stored in the cache
	- response - Performs on the response before delivering to the client

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#header_c4257a0fd0eb017ea47b1fbb318fd61c)

**Description:**

Deletes a Header object by name.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update URL with **header_name**

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#header_4bbb73fffda4d189bf5a19b474399a83)

item.name: Healthcheck
item.description:
Healthchecks are used to customize the way Fastly checks on your Backends. If an origin server is marked unhealthy due to health checks, Fastly will stop attempting to send requests to it. If all origin servers are marked unhealthy, Fastly will attempt to serve stale. If no stale object is available, a 503 will be returned to the client.

[Healthcheck Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#healthcheck)

request.description:
**Description:**

List all of the healthchecks for a particular service and version.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#healthcheck_126cb37382d68583269420ba772ded36)

**Description:**

Create a healthcheck for a particular service and version.

**Request Configuration:**

- **check_interval** [integer] - How often to run the healthcheck in milliseconds.
- **comment** [string] - A comment.
- **expected_response** [integer] - The status code expected from the host.
- **host** [string] - Which host to check.
- **http_version** [integer] - Whether to use version 1.0 or 1.1 HTTP.
- **initial** [integer] - When loading a config, the initial number of probes to be seen as OK.
- **method** [string] - Which HTTP method to use.
- **name** [string] - The name of the healthcheck.
- **path** [string] - The path to check.
- **threshold** [integer] - How many healthchecks must succeed to be considered healthy.
- **timeout** [integer] - Timeout in milliseconds.
- **window** [integer] - The number of most recent healthcheck queries to keep for this healthcheck.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#healthcheck_8712be8923dd419c54393da3ac31f6d3)

**Description:**

Get the healthcheck for a particular service and version.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update URL with **healthcheck_name**

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#healthcheck_b54ea357a2377e62ae7649e609b94966)

**Description:**

Update the healthcheck for a particular service and version.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update URL with **healthcheck_name**
- **check_interval** [integer] - How often to run the healthcheck in milliseconds.
- **comment** [string] - A comment.
- **expected_response** [integer] - The status code expected from the host.
- **host** [string] - Which host to check.
- **http_version** [integer] - Whether to use version 1.0 or 1.1 HTTP.
- **initial** [integer] - When loading a config, the initial number of probes to be seen as OK.
- **method** [string] - Which HTTP method to use.
- **name** [string] - The name of the healthcheck.
- **path** [string] - The path to check.
- **threshold** [integer] - How many healthchecks must succeed to be considered healthy.
- **timeout** [integer] - Timeout in milliseconds.
- **window** [integer] - The number of most recent healthcheck queries to keep for this healthcheck.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#healthcheck_9a60b6005125c4afeaa80111e69d7586)

**Description:**

Delete the healthcheck for a particular service and version.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update URL with **healthcheck_name**

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#healthcheck_a22900c40a2fd59db5028061dc5dfa36)

item.name: Request Settings
item.description:
Settings used to customize Fastly's request handling. When used with Conditions the Request Settings object allows you to fine tune how specific types of requests are handled.

[Request Settings Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#request_settings)

request.description:
**Description:**

Returns a list of all Request Settings objects for the given service and version.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#request_settings_c98bc45765ce2b1ffd414402ed46746a)

body.raw:
{
	"action": "lookup",
	"bypass_busy_wait": false,
	"default_host": null,
	"force_miss": false,
	"force_ssl": false,
	"geo_headers": true,
	"hash_keys": null,
	"max_stale_age": 60,
	"name": "your_request_settings",
	"request_condition": null,
	"timer_support": false,
	"xff": "append"
}

request.description:
**Description:**

Creates a new Request Settings object.

**Request Configuration:**

- **action** [string] - Allows you to terminate request handling and immediately perform an action. When set it can be lookup or pass (ignore the cache completely).
- **bypass_busy_wait** [boolean] - Disable collapsed forwarding, so you don't wait for other objects to origin.
- **default_host** [string] - Sets the host header.
- **force_miss** [boolean] - Allows you to force a cache miss for the request. Replaces the item in the cache if the content is cacheable.
- **force_ssl** [boolean] - Forces the request use SSL (redirects a non-SSL to SSL).
- **geo_headers** [boolean] - Injects Fastly-Geo-Country, Fastly-Geo-City, and Fastly-Geo-Region into the request headers.
- **hash_keys** [string] - Comma separated list of varnish request object fields that should be in the hash key.
- **max_stale_age** [integer] - How old an object is allowed to be to serve stale-if-error or stale-while-revalidate.
- **name** [string] - Name for the request settings.
- **request_condition** [string] - Name of condition object used to test whether or not these settings should be used.
- **timer_support** [boolean] - Injects the X-Timer info into the request for viewing origin fetch durations.
- **xff** [string] - Short for X-Forwarded-For, should be:
	- clear
	- leave
	- append
	- append_all
	- overwrite

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#request_settings_9d998e8a3ab30f9e01d1025b82d2d798)

**Description:**

Gets the specified Request Settings object.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update URL with **request_settings_name**

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#request_settings_db0338e03fa36787e13f4e4026f73753)

body.raw:
{
	"action": "lookup",
	"bypass_busy_wait": false,
	"default_host": null,
	"force_miss": false,
	"force_ssl": false,
	"geo_headers": true,
	"hash_keys": null,
	"max_stale_age": 60,
	"name": "your_request_settings",
	"request_condition": null,
	"timer_support": false,
	"xff": "append"
}

request.description:
**Description:**

Updates the specified Request Settings object.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update URL with **request_settings_name**
- **action** [string] - Allows you to terminate request handling and immediately perform an action. When set it can be lookup or pass (ignore the cache completely).
- **bypass_busy_wait** [boolean] - Disable collapsed forwarding, so you don't wait for other objects to origin.
- **default_host** [string] - Sets the host header.
- **force_miss** [boolean] - Allows you to force a cache miss for the request. Replaces the item in the cache if the content is cacheable.
- **force_ssl** [boolean] - Forces the request use SSL (redirects a non-SSL to SSL).
- **geo_headers** [boolean] - Injects Fastly-Geo-Country, Fastly-Geo-City, and Fastly-Geo-Region into the request headers.
- **hash_keys** [string] - Comma separated list of varnish request object fields that should be in the hash key.
- **max_stale_age** [integer] - How old an object is allowed to be to serve stale-if-error or stale-while-revalidate.
- **name** [string] - Name for the request settings.
- **request_condition** [string] - Name of condition object used to test whether or not these settings should be used.
- **timer_support** [boolean] - Injects the X-Timer info into the request for viewing origin fetch durations.
- **xff** [string] - Short for X-Forwarded-For, should be:
	- clear
	- leave
	- append
	- append_all
	- overwrite

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#request_settings_daff48a5aee7dfa22d9d8a7d9dbc8803)

**Description:**

Removes the specified Request Settings object.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update URL with **request_settings_name**

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#request_settings_f5840761113247566338f97d7e26d20e)

item.name: Response Object
item.description:
Allows you to create synthetic responses that exist entirely on the varnish machine. Useful for creating error or maintenance pages that exists outside the scope of your datacenter. Best when used with [Condition](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#condition) objects.

[Response Object Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#response_object)

request.description:
**Description:**

Returns all Response Objects for the specified service and version.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#response_object_23a204e8990ec3c07556f31e48bf6394)

**Description:**

Creates a new Response Object.

**Request Configuration:**

- **cache_condition** [string] - Name of the condition checked after we have retrieved an object. If the condition passes then deliver this Request Object instead.
- **content** [string] - The content to deliver for the response object, can be empty.
- **content_type** [string] - The MIME type of the content, can be empty.
- **name** [string] - Name that identifies the Response Object.
- **request_condition** [string] - Name of the condition to be checked during the request phase. If the condition passes then this object will be delivered.
- **response** [string] - The HTTP Response, defaults to "Ok"
- **status** [string] - The HTTP Status Code, defaults to 200.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#response_object_69864bff7d00bf4c82dbb44be8ee45f4)

**Description:**

Gets the specified Response Object.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update URL with **response_object_name**

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#response_object_86eee1a775e72abb37f1ee364862a6b6)

**Description:**

Updates the specified Response Object.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update URL with **response_object_name**
- **cache_condition** [string] - Name of the condition checked after we have retrieved an object. If the condition passes then deliver this Request Object instead.
- **content** [string] - The content to deliver for the response object, can be empty.
- **content_type** [string] - The MIME type of the content, can be empty.
- **name** [string] - Name that identifies the Response Object.
- **request_condition** [string] - Name of the condition to be checked during the request phase. If the condition passes then this object will be delivered.
- **response** [string] - The HTTP Response, defaults to "Ok"
- **status** [string] - The HTTP Status Code, defaults to 200.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#response_object_60ca76a86f3427d7f85a00ec8eb25b3e)

**Description:**

**Request Configuration:**

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#response_object_50fb3ca925978a9c56e97906ed09ea48)

item.name: Service

item.name: Stats
item.description:
Stats give you information on the usage and performance of your Service. They can be request by Service and over a particular time span. Stats are broken down per datacenter, giving you information on how your Services are being used across the world. There is now a more flexible, and fully featured Stats API available.

[Stats Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#stats)

request.description:

item.name: VCL Snippets
item.description:
VCL Snippets are blocks of VCL logic inserted into your service's configuration that don't require custom VCL.

[VCL Snippets Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#snippet)

request.description:
**Description:**

List all snippets for a particular service and version.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#snippet_e2ba7946be5a13ee64b7e7edb481b934)

**Description:**

Create a snippet for a particular service and version.

**Request Configuration:**

- **name** [string] - The name for the snippet.
- **priority** [integer] - Priority determines the ordering for multiple snippets. Lower numbers execute first.
- **dynamic** [integer] - Sets the snippet version to regular (0) or dynamic (1).
- **content** [string] - The VCL code that specifies exactly what the snippet does.
- **type** [string] - The location in generated VCL where the snippet should be placed. Type can be either:
	- init - Place the snippet above all subroutines.
	- recv - Place the snippet within the vcl_recv subroutine but below the boilerplate VCL and above any objects.
	- hit - Place the snippet within the vcl_hit subroutine.
	- miss - Place the snippet within the vcl_miss subroutine.
	- pass - Place the snippet within the vcl_pass subroutine.
	- fetch - Place the snippet within the vcl_fetch subroutine.
	- error - Place the snippet within the vcl_error subroutine.
	- deliver - Place the snippet within the vcl_deliver subroutine.
	- log - Place the snippet within the vcl_log subroutine.
	- none - Don't render the snippet in VCL so it can be manually included in custom VCL.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#snippet_41e0e11c662d4d56adada215e707f30d)

**Description:**

Get a single dynamic snippet for a particular service.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update URL with **snippet_id**

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#snippet_abbda4e60ce93b7cb85bd6377623da0d)

**Request Configuration:**

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#snippet_31c1d5fa32accf180f5af28fa77cc138)

Get a single snippet for a particular service and version.

**Request Configuration:**

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/config#snippet_33b5e47ae6fe6511169591ef9f43a2f4)

**Request Configuration:**

item.name: Purging
item.description: Fastly offers an active content purging system. The API calls related to purging are listed below.

item.name: Purging
item.description:
Instant Purging removes content from Fastly immediately so it can be refreshed from your origin servers.

[Purging Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/purge#purge)

request.description:
**Description:**

Instant Purge an individual URL. The main entry point https://api.fastly.com/ for the API is not needed for an individual URL Instant Purge.

By default, authentication is not required to purge a URL with the Fastly API, but you can enable API token authentication in the Fastly web interface by adding a header or by using custom VCL. Please review the Fastly [docs](https://docs.fastly.com/guides/purging/authenticating-api-purge-requests#purging-urls-with-an-api-token) for further information.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update URL with **individual_url**

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/purge#purge_3aa1d66ee81dbfed0b03deed0fa16a9a)

**Description:**

Instant Purge an individual URL with an API token.

In order to secure individual URL purge requests you'll need to enable API token authentication in the Fastly web interface by adding a header or by using custom VCL. Please review the Fastly [docs](https://docs.fastly.com/guides/purging/authenticating-api-purge-requests#purging-urls-with-an-api-token) for further information.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update URL with **individual_url**

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/guides/purging/authenticating-api-purge-requests#purging-urls-with-an-api-token)

**Description:**

Instant Purge everything from a service.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/purge#purge_bee5ed1a0cfd541e8b9f970a44718546)

**Description:**

Instant Purge a particular service of items tagged with a Surrogate Key. Only one surrogate key can be purged at a time. Multiple keys can be purged using a batch surrogate key purge request.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update URL with **surrogate_key**

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/purge#purge_d8b8e8be84c350dd92492453a3df3230)

**Description:**

Instant Purge a particular service of items tagged with Surrogate Keys in a batch. Up to 256 surrogate keys can be purged in one batch request.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update **Surrogate_key** header (Surrogate Keys don't need to be separated by commas!)

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/purge#purge_db35b293f8a724717fcf25628d713583)

**Description:**

Instant Purge a particular service of items tagged with Surrogate Keys in a batch using a JSON POST body. Up to 256 surrogate keys can be purged in one batch request.

**Request Configuration:**

- **surrogate_keys** [array of strings] - Surrogate Keys.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/purge#purge_db35b293f8a724717fcf25628d713583)

item.name: Soft Purging
item.description:
Soft Purging sets an object's TTL to 0s, forcing revalidation. For best results, Soft Purging should be used in conjuction with stale_while_revalidate and stale_if_error.

[Soft Purging Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/purge#soft_purge)

request.description:
**Description:**

Soft Purge an individual URL. The main entry point https://api.fastly.com/ for the API is not needed for an individual URL Instant Purge.

By default, authentication is not required to purge a URL with the Fastly API, but you can enable API token authentication in the Fastly web interface by adding a header or by using custom VCL. Please review the Fastly [docs](https://docs.fastly.com/guides/purging/authenticating-api-purge-requests#purging-urls-with-an-api-token) for further information.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update URL with **individual_url**

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/purge#soft_purge_0c4f56f3d68e9bed44fb8b638b78ea36)

**Description:**

Soft Purge an individual URL with an API token.

In order to secure individual URL soft purge requests you'll need to enable API token authentication in the Fastly web interface by adding a header or by using custom VCL. Please review the Fastly [docs](https://docs.fastly.com/guides/purging/authenticating-api-purge-requests#purging-urls-with-an-api-token) for further information.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update URL with **individual_url**

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/guides/purging/authenticating-api-purge-requests#purging-urls-with-an-api-token)

**Description:**

Soft Purge a particular service of items tagged with a key. Only one surrogate key can be purged at a time. Multiple keys can be purged using multiple purge requests.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update URL with **surrogate_key**

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/purge#soft_purge_2e4d29085640127739f8467f27a5b549)

item.name: Historical Stats
item.description:
The Fastly Historical Stats API (i.e., the Stats API) is a RESTful API that allows Fastly customers to query historical caching stats such as number of requests, hit ratio, and number of errors. The Stats API provides an advanced querying interface that allows for fine grained time period, regional, and sampling control. This document provides a basic overview of Stats and documents all available endpoints.

[Historical Stats Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/stats#historical)

request.description:
**Description:**

Fetches historical stats for each of your Fastly services and groups the results by service ID.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/stats#historical_0a4fe23e9386277695ad9966c38b0e47)

**Description:**

Fetches historical stats for each of your Fastly services and groups the results by service ID.

Date parsing is performed using the Chronic ruby library; for the most detailed information on exactly what formats are available please visit the [Chronic](https://github.com/mojombo/chronic) repository.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update query string **minutes** parameter in URL
- Update query string **by** [minute, hour, day] parameter in URL
- Update query string **region** [usa, europe, anzac, asia, latam, south_africa] parameter in URL

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/stats#historical_0a4fe23e9386277695ad9966c38b0e47)

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/stats#historical_99369fb79ebecf90cc944d5dce49cc31)

**Description:**

Returns month-to-date usage details for a given month and year. Usage details are aggregated by service and across all Fastly services, and then grouped by region.

This endpoint does not use the `from` or `to` fields for selecting the date for which data is requested. Instead, it uses `month` and `year` integer fields. Both fields are optional and default to the current month and year respectively. When set, an optional `billable_units` field will convert bandwidth to GB and divide requests by 10,000.

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/stats#historical_864bd24a3fc04848fe72f094d6f19261)

**Description:**

Returns month-to-date usage details for a given month and year. Usage details are aggregated by service and across all Fastly services, and then grouped by region.

This endpoint does not use the `from` or `to` fields for selecting the date for which data is requested. Instead, it uses `month` and `year` integer fields. Both fields are optional and default to the current month and year respectively. When set, an optional `billable_units` field will convert bandwidth to GB and divide requests by 10,000.

**Request Configuration:**

- Update query string **month** parameter in URL
- Update query string **year** parameter in URL
- Update query string **billable_units** parameter in URL

[Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/stats#historical_864bd24a3fc04848fe72f094d6f19261)

item.name: Remote logging
item.description: Fastly offers logging to a number of formats and platforms. In addition to offering syslog streams, we offer logs shipped in various formats and to various hosted logging providers.

This is a temporary controller to test a new S3 library and, as such, is part of a limited availability release. For more information, see our [product and feature life cycle descriptions](https://docs.fastly.com/guides/fastly-product-lifecycle/#limited-availability). If you would like to try it, please contact support@fastly.com.

item.name: Heroku
item.description: Fastly will stream log messages to the Heroku account, and in the format specified in the Heroku object. This feature is part of a limited availability release. For more information, see our [product and feature life cycle descriptions](https://docs.fastly.com/guides/fastly-product-lifecycle/#limited-availability). If you would like to try it, please contact support@fastly.com.
